indicador_disponible: Índices de paridad (entre mujeres y hombres, quintiles de riqueza superior e inferior, municipios de más y menos de 10.000 habitantes y personas con y sin limitaciones por problemas de salud) en la realización de actividades educativas (formales o no formales) en los últimos 12 o 4 semanas
objetivo_global: 4- Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
meta_global: 4.5 By 2030, eliminate gender disparities in education and ensure equal access to all levels of education and vocational training for the vulnerable, including persons with disabilities, indigenous peoples and children in vulnerable situations
definicion:
Relationship between the proportions among the following groups who have participated in educational activities
(formal or non-formal) in the last 12 months or 4 weeks:

- Women and men between 18 and 64 years of age (in the last 12 months)
- People between 18 and 64 years of age belonging to households in the lowest and highest income brackets 
  (in the last 12 months)
- People between 18 and 64 years of age with and without limitations due to health problems (serious or non-serious) 
  (in the last 12 months)
- People between 15 and 64 years of age residing in municipalities with fewer than 10,000 inhabitants and more 
  than 10,000 inhabitants (in the last 4 weeks)
formula:
$$IPD = \frac{[Ind_i]_d}{[Ind_i]_a}$$

where:

$IPD$ = Parity Index in dimension (Sex, Wealth, Location, etc.)

$Ind_i$ = Education Index: participation in educational activities (formal or informal) 
in last 12 months or 4 weeks

$d$ = Disadvantaged group (women, poorer people, people living in small towns, people 
with limitations due to health problems)

$a$ = Favored group (men, wealthier people, people living in large municipalities,
people without health limitations)
observaciones: The reference value for this indicator is 1, which indicates absolute parity.  The degree of disparity is greater the further the indicator value is from 1, reflecting  an unfavorable or favorable situation for the numerator population group relative to the  denominator population group, depending on whether the value is lower or higher than 1,  respectively.
texto_oceca: Indicador calculado utilizando una metodología armonizada entre los órganos centrales de estadística de las comunidades autónomas.
justificacion_global:
To measure the general level of disparity between two sub-populations of interest  with regard to a given indicator. The further from 1 the parity index lies, the greater  the disparity between the two groups of interest. 
Source: United Nations Statistics Division

es.objetivo_global: 4- Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
es.meta_global: 4.5 By 2030, eliminate gender disparities in education and ensure equal access to all levels of education and vocational training for the vulnerable, including persons with disabilities, indigenous peoples and children in vulnerable situations
es.definicion:
Relación entre las proporciones entre los siguientes grupos que han realizado actividades 
educativas (formales o no formales) en los últimos 12 meses o 4 semanas:

 - Mujeres y hombres entre 18 y 64 años (en los últimos 12 meses)
 - Personas entre 18 y 64 años pertenecientes a hogares que se encuentran en el nivel 
   de ingresos inferior y superior (en los últimos 12 meses) 
 - Personas entre 18 y 64 años con y sin limitaciones por problemas de salud 
   (graves o no graves)(en los últimos 12 meses)
 - Personas entre 15 y 64 años residentes en municipios de menos de 10.000 habitantes y más de 10.000 
   habitantes (en las últimas 4 semanas)
es.formula:
$$IPD = \frac{[Ind_i]_d}{[Ind_i]_a}$$

donde:

$IPD$ = el Índice de Paridad de la Dimensión (Sexo, Riqueza, Ubicación, etc.)

$Ind_i$ = el Indicador de Educación: realización de actividades educativas (formales o no formales) en 
los últimos  12 meses o 4 semanas

$d$ = el grupo desfavorecido (mujeres, personas más pobres, personas que viven en municipios pequeños, 
personas con limitaciones por problemas de salud)

$a$ = el grupo favorecido (hombres, personas más ricas, personas que viven en municipios grandes, 
personas sin limitaciones por problemas de salud)
es.observaciones: El valor de referencia de este indicador es 1, que se tiene cuando la paridad es absoluta.  El grado de disparidad es mayor cuanto más se aleja de 1 el valor del indicador, reflejando  una situación desfavorable o favorable del grupo poblacional del numerador respecto al  grupo poblacional del denominador según tome un valor inferior o superior a 1 respectivamente.
es.texto_oceca: Indicador calculado utilizando una metodología armonizada entre los órganos centrales de estadística de las comunidades autónomas.
es.justificacion_global:
Medir el nivel general de disparidad entre dos subpoblaciones de interés con respecto a un  indicador determinado. Cuanto más alejado de 1 se encuentre el índice de paridad, mayor será la  disparidad entre los dos grupos de interés. 
Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas

STAT_CONC_DEF__GLOBAL:
Definition:

Parity indices require data for the specific groups of interest. They represent the ratio of the indicator value for one group to that of the other. Typically, the likely more disadvantaged group is placed in the numerator. A value of exactly 1 indicates parity between the two groups.

Concepts:

See metadata for relevant underlying indicator.
UNIT_MEASURE__GLOBAL: Ratio. This indicator is expressed as the ratio of the value of the indicator for the likely more disadvantaged group to that of the likely more advantaged group.
SOURCE_TYPE__GLOBAL: The sources are the same as for the underlying indicators for this goal.
INST_MANDATE__GLOBAL:
The UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) is the statistical branch of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The Institute produces internationally comparable data and methodologies in the fields of education, science, culture and communication for countries at all stages of development.

The Education 2030 Framework for Action §100 has clearly stated that: “In recognition of the importance of harmonization of monitoring and reporting, the UIS will remain the official source of cross-nationally comparable data on education. It will continue to produce international monitoring indicators based on its annual education survey and on other data sources that guarantee international comparability for more than 200 countries and territories. In addition to collecting data, the UIS will work with partners to develop new indicators, statistical approaches and monitoring tools to better assess progress across the targets related to UNESCO’s mandate, working in coordination with the SDG-Education 2030 SC”.
RATIONALE__GLOBAL: To measure the general level of disparity between two sub-populations of interest with regard to a given indicator. The further from 1 the parity index lies, the greater the disparity between the two groups of interest.
REC_USE_LIM__GLOBAL: The indicator is not symmetrical about 1 but a simple transformation can make it so (by inverting ratios that exceed 1 and subtracting them from 2). This will make interpretation easier.
DATA_COMP__GLOBAL:
The indicator value of the likely more disadvantaged group is divided by the indicator value of the other sub-population of interest.

D P I   =   l n d i d l n d i a

where:

DPI = the Dimension (Gender, Wealth, Location, etc.) Parity Index

Indi = the Education 2030 Indicator i for which an equity measure is needed.

d = the likely disadvantaged group (e.g. female, poorest, etc.)

a = the likely advantaged group (e.g. male, richest, etc.)
